pages.title: Diskagma
pages.text: $(l)Temporal Range:$() Paleoproterozoic (Rhyacian)$(br2)$(l)Habitat:$() Terrestrial$(br)$(l)Propagation:$() $(l:basics/collecting_plants)Spore-bearing plants$(/l)$(br)$(l)Method of Obtaining:$() Shears

Diskagma is a poorly understood multicellular organism found in terrestrial soils from the Rhyacian period in what is now South Africa. While it has been tentatively classified as a fungus in the division glomeromycota, the extreme age of the fossils casts doubt on this, as they pre-date the commonly accepted origin of eukaryotic life by at least 400 million years, as well as the possibly eukaryotic Francevillian forms by 100 million years.
